page.title: 06THE VILLAGE POST OFFICE
page.content: The Post Office is in many ways the centre of the village community. .The people who own the post office are new to the village having only been there for 8 months Their busiest day is Thursday.There were 107 people in on Thursday.The quietest day is Wednesday 45 people came(because it is half day closing.) The post office was built in 1880 so it is 105 years old.It is also an off licence and a general store so it is quite busy.The post office is the only shop in Horseheath(for the elderly of the village, with no cars, the nearest shops mean a bus ride to Haverhill or Cambridge) .They open from 8.15a.m.until 6.0pm.Mon to Sat(close 1.15pm Wed)Of the 28 households responding to a survey,19 shopped chiefly in Haverhill 4 else_ where,& 5(all retired)at the P. O.
